ovdesc.p: This file holds the parameters that will be used to assign the tape unit and to select the report/delivery output that is to be saved to magnetic tape ready for microfiching.

It allows the user to define the tape unit and density to be used, what is to be saved to tape, the fiche title, sort fields for delivery output, the fiche cycle name and the cut off date and time for selecting the items.

desc.p: Stores the last cut off time for the last cycle name.
Displayed in format HH:MM
System maintained. This is a NOINPUT field.
Specifies the name by which this fiche cycle will be identified.

The name entered here will be used to identify all the records selected for this fiche cycle from files F.FICHE.HOLD.CONTROL and F.FICHE.DE.HEADER. When the records have been written to tape the cycle name entered here will be moved to field LAST.CYCLE.NAME and the records identified by the previous entry in LAST.CYCLE.NAME will be deleted from the files.
If another tape is to be produced of records selected by the LAST.CYCLE.NAME then the fields NEW.CYCLE.NAME, CUT.OFF.DATE and CUT.OFF.TIME should be left blank.
If field LAST.CYCLE.NAME is blank then a new cycle name, cut off date and time should be specified.
0-20 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
Specifies the Selection criteria by which the FICHE.HOLD.CONTROL file will be selected.

Any valid Universe selection criteria using field names of the file F.FICHE.HOLD.CONTROL can be specified. This can be used to create separate Microfiche cycles e.g. all reports with name of CRF.CONTROL can be fiched in one cycle by specifying WITH REPORT.NAME EQ CRF.CONTROL in this field.
Long Selection Criteria can be input by adding more multi value fields.
Up to 35 Alphanumeric characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Defines the density (bits per inch) at which the tape is to be written.
The bits per inch density at which the tape should be written should be specified here.
Note: It should be ensured that the microfiche company can accept tapes written at this density.
1-4 Numeric digits. The valid density values are: 800, 1600, 3200, 6250 (Mandatory input)
Specifies what output (reports or delivery) is to be saved to tape.

This field specifies what output is to be saved to tape i.e. both report and delivery output, delivery output only or report output only. If "BOTH" is specified then the reports are saved first followed by the delivery output.

1-8 alpha characters. The allowed values are: BOTH - Both reports and delivery output will be saved to tape. DELIVERY - Only delivery output will be saved to tape. REPORTS - Only report output will be saved to tape. (Mandatory input)
Specifies the magnetic tape unit to be assigned.
This field specifies the magnetic tape unit that will be used for saving the tape. The tape should be loaded on this unit and rewound to the beginning and the unit set to on-line.
1-2 numeric characters. (Optional input)
This field is reserved for future expansion.
This is a NOINPUT field.

Universe command or routine name to be executed for each report to be fiched. Rather than attempt to hard code the format for each fiche tape this field allows you to control the format of each report as it is processed. This could be as simple as copying the report to another directory for later processing or you could write your own routine to format the reports for a specific microfiche package.
Fields may be used in the command sentence with the intention of having them replaced by T24 before the sentence is executed. In this case they must be of the following format:
i) A valid entry on FILE.CONTROL
ii) Followed by '>' (greater than sign)
iii) Plus a valid multivalue entry in SYS.FIELD.NAME on STANDARD.SELECTION
iv) The whole to be contained within '&' (ampersand).
For example any item from FICHE.HOLD.CONTROL could have its report name, say 'CRF.CNTRL' translated through REPORT.CONTROL to extract the local reference which could be used to provide the output ID.
For example:

The Unix 'cat' command may be used to concatenate data being processed by this application into the area to be accessed by a microfiche system. In the case of a FICHE.HOLD.CONTROL item identified as '8633474800' a command entered thus:
SH -c "cat F.FICHE.HOLD/&FICHE.HOLD.CONTROL>@ID& > /oplink/&REPORT.CONTROL>OPLINK.ID&"
would be translated by T24 into the following executable command:
SH -c "cat F.FICHE.HOLD/8633474800 > /oplink/reval"
The effect of this command would be to concatenate each report, with the same OPLINK.ID (a local reference on REPORT.CONTROL) into a directory called /oplink.
If you were writing a DataBasic program to process the report then arguments could be supplied in the same manner as above and accessed in your program using the variable @SENTENCE. e.g:
OPLINK.FORMATTER &FICHE.HOLD.CONTROL>@ID&

In your routine, OPLINK.FORMATTER, @SENTENCE would equal "OPLINK.FORMATTER 8633474800", which you could then use to read the F.FICHE.HOLD record to format it to your requiremnets and the write it to another file/directory.
The existence of a command in this field will cause the run program to perform the command instead of writing to tape.
UNIX commands must also be enclosed within quotation marks, specify full path names where necessary and be preceded by the UNIVERSE command: SH -c.

This field is multi-valued to allow for multiple commands, executed in sequence for each report, and sub-valued for lengthy commands. Where a command needs to be split over a number of sub-values care should be taken regarding spaces and separators - individual sub-values are simply concatenated together prior to execution.
Up to 50 characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Stores the last cut off date for the last cycle name.
Displayed in the format DD MMM YYYY.
System maintained. This is a NOINPUT field.
Defines the title that is to appear on the top of each fiche.
The title entered in this field will appear at the top of each fiche created from the tape.
1-28 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Mandatory input)
This field is reserved for future expansion.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Stores the last cycle name.
0-20 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
System maintained. This is a NOINPUT field.
Defines the cut off date (business) to be used for selecting the records to be saved.

The cut off date (business) for selecting all reports/delivery output should be specified here. The selection will be based on output produced less than or equal to this date and time (specified in CUT.OFF.TIME).
When the selected records have been saved then the date specified here will be moved to LAST.CUT.OFF.DATE.
0-11 type D (date format DDMMYY).
Defines the cut off time to be used for selecting the records to be saved.
The cut off time for selecting all report/delivery output should be specified here. The selection will be based on output produced less than or equal to the date (CUT.OFF.DATE) and this time.
When the selected records have been saved then the time entered here will be moved to LAST.CUT.OFF.TIME.
0-4 numeric characters with optional ':' i.e. HHMM or HH:MM
Specifies the field numbers by which the delivery output will be sorted.
The DE.O.HEADER dictionary field numbers by which the delivery messages will be sorted should be entered here.
1-3 numeric characters. (Mandatory input.)
Defines the name of the fiche record.
This field allows the user to setup separate records on the file defining different selection criteria for the fiche cycles.
1-10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Mandatory input)
